channel.title: Posts on R & Analiz
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on R & Analiz

item.title: Grouped Histograms
item.description: Import dataset (code below only works if file is in working directory) med <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fabricandofitfaber/mayhem/master/MedicalData.csv') Calculate measures of center (mean, median) mean(med$BMI) ## [1] 32.91226 median(med$BMI) ## [1] 31.6 Calculate measures of spread (standard deviation, 5# summary) sd(med$BMI) ## [1] 7.308377 fivenum(med$BMI) ## [1] 19.40 27.95 31.60 37.00 55.20 Create histogram hist(med$BMI,main='Distribution of BMI',xlab='BMI',right=F) Change number of bins in histogram hist(med$BMI,main='Distribution of BMI',xlab='BMI',right=F,breaks=15) Create boxplot boxplot(med$BMI,main='Distribution of BMI',ylab='BMI')

item.title: Frequency Tables
item.description: Import dataset (code below only works if file is in working directory) med <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fabricandofitfaber/mayhem/master/MedicalData.csv') Create and view frequency table of age groups agetab <- table(med$Age) agetab ## ## adult older adult young adult ## 99 27 29 View table proportions prop.table(agetab) ## ## adult older adult young adult ## 0.6387097 0.1741935 0.1870968 Create bar chart barplot(agetab,main='Age Distribution',xlab='Age Group',ylab='Frequency',ylim=c(0,100)) Re-order age categories med$Age <- factor(med$Age, levels=c('young adult','adult','older adult')) Re-run bar chart agetab <- table(med$Age) barplot(agetab,main='Age Distribution',xlab='Age Group',ylab='Frequency',ylim=c(0,100))

item.title: Contingency Tables
item.description: Import dataset post <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fabricandofitfaber/mayhem/master/PostSurvey.csv') Create contingency table gendsport <- table(post$UT_sport, post$gender) gendsport ## ## Female Male ## no 150 16 ## yes 40 8 Row percentages prop.table(gendsport,1) ## ## Female Male ## no 0.90361446 0.09638554 ## yes 0.83333333 0.16666667 Column percentages prop.table(gendsport,2) ## ## Female Male ## no 0.7894737 0.6666667 ## yes 0.2105263 0.3333333 Make grouped bar chart barplot(gendsport,beside=T,legend=T,main='Play Sports by Gender', xlab='Gender',ylab='Frequency') Make mosaic plot barplot(prop.

item.title: Türkiye Mutluluk Endeksi Haritası
item.description: packages install.packages(“tidyverse”) install.packages(“sp”) # for spatial data install.packages(“map”) install.packages(“mapproj”) install.packages(“ggmap”) install.packages(“DeducerSpatial”) install.packages(“maps”) help(package = “maps”) Loading required package: maps require(maps) map(“usa”) # map komutu harita ve poligon çizimi için kullanılıyor map(“county”) data(unemp) # data komutu yardımıyla R’ın içerisinde yer alan dataları enviromentimizie yüklüyoruz. data(county.fips) head(unemp) # datamızın ilk 6 satırını görmek için head komutunu kullanıyoruz. head(county.fips) colors <- c("#F1EEF6”, “#D4B9DA”, “#C994C7”, “#DF65B0”, “#DD1C77”, “#980043”) unemp$colorBuckets <- as.numeric(cut(unemp$unemp, c(0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 100))) head(unemp)

item.title: RStudio'da .xlsx Dosyası Oluşturmak
item.description: library(openxlsx) workbook <- createWorkbook() addWorksheet(workbook, “birinci_sayfa”) addWorksheet(workbook, “ikinci_sayfa”) writeData(workbook, “birinci_sayfa”, mtcars) writeData(workbook, “ikinci_sayfa”, iris) saveWorkbook(workbook, file = “my_workbook.xlsx”, overwrite = TRUE)

item.title: Hakkımda
item.description: Başlık 1 Burada editliyoruz yazıyı Başlık 2 Burada kodlar verilir. mydata <- mtcars plot(mtcars)

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
